title: Does anybody recognize this upright script?
content:
Does anybody recognize this upright script?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015001932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font4_6519.PNG)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font4.PNG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015001932/http:/typophile.com/files/font4.PNG) | 65.89 KB |
author: pacedesign

comments.content:
One of my favorites.

The "w" is quite badly mangled. I can understand that they couldn't handle the blackletter-style original, but they could have gotten somebody who knows how to properly modify letterforms to do it... John, if you also mind the original "w" (and the "v") , and have a -modest- budget, you can find people on Typophile (including yours truly) to do it right.

hhp

> The "w" is quite badly mangled. I can understand that they couldn't handle the blackletter-style original, but they could have gotten somebody who knows how to properly modify letterforms to do it...

Jeez that’s unrecognisable, except in context I doubt the majority of people would realise what it’s supposed to be!
